intro: Gormania obtusata, commonly known as the blunt-leaved gormania, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in dense undergrowth of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
